name: Agha Ali Raza
content: Agha Ali Raza Dr. Agha Ali Raza araza <at> cs.cmu.eduagha.ali.raza <at> lums.edu.pk Home Biography Teaching Research Projects Publications Grants Press Academic Services I am an Associate Professor of Computer Science at the Lahore University of Management Sciences (LUMS), Pakistan. I am a Fulbright Scholar. I have done my PhD in Computer Science with a specialization in Language Technologies from the Language Technologies Institute, School of Computer Science at Carnegie Mellon University, where I was advised by Roni Rosenfeld. I am also the founding director of the Center for Speech and Language Technologies (CSaLT) at LUMS (previously at ITU). My research focusses on Speech and Natural Language Processing, Speech-based Human Computer Interfaces, Machine Learning, and Information & Communication Technologies for Development (ICT4D). I teach Machine Learning, Speech Processing, and Data Structures at graduate and undergraduate levels. I have been a faculty member at FAST NU Lahore between 2005 and 2010, at ITU between 2015 and 2019, and at LUMS since 2020. Please see my bio for more details on who I am and what I do..
